summary: Add comprehensive type safety tests for user-defined function APIs across signals, updates, queries, workflows, activities, and schedules to catch type coherency deficiencies that could allow incorrect user code to compile.
userImpact: Users could write type-unsafe code that compiles but fails at runtime because type assertions don't catch all invalid argument patterns and function signatures.
rootCause: Inconsistent and incomplete type-safety test coverage across APIs that accept user-defined functions, allowing type coherency deficiencies to be introduced and persist undetected.
proposedFix: Assess current typing test coverage and add missing tests for all user-defined function APIs, following patterns already established in test-interface-type-safety.ts.
keyQuote: deficiencies that affect incorrect user code (i.e. some code that should not compile does due to improper typing rules)
